definition: bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: 35So it is stated elsewhere: "'You will not let your Holy One see decay.'
sentences.chinese: 又有一篇上說，你必不叫你的聖者見朽壞。

sentences.english: Wherefore he saith also in another [psalm], Thou shalt not suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.
sentences.chinese: 又有一篇上說，你必不叫你的聖者見朽壞。

sentences.english: His body did not undergo decay but became glorious.
sentences.chinese: 祂的身體不但不見朽壞，且變爲榮耀。

sentences.english: And this Empyreal substance cannot fail.
sentences.chinese: 賦有輕清的靈質，不能朽壞。
賦有輕清的靈質，不能朽壞。

sentences.english: The flooring is rotten and the walls are full of cracks .
sentences.chinese: 地板朽壞了，牆壁也滿是裂縫。

sentences.english: 37But the one whom God raised from the dead did not see decay.
sentences.chinese: 惟獨神所復活的，他並未見朽壞。

definition: Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
lit. the cycle comes back to the start (idiom); to move in circles/the wheel comes full circle
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to have been through the hardships of life/to have been through the mill
